result.execSummary:
The defendant Julio A Lopez Ruiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court does not object to an Interstate Compact.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $1000 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted, if any, shall be applied.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $44.99 plus surcharges.
May not have contact with Kohl's Department Store, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Court does not object to an Interstate Compact.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every  3 days of work performed.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Julio A Lopez Ruiz, appeared with Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson. Interpreter Leo Martin in court.  Clerk: PT
Interpreter Martin is sworn in.  State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 1/2 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 9 months in the KCJ commencing on 4/16/16 at 8:00 AM.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.  Restitution ordered in the amount of $44.99 as stipulated to by parties.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Kohls Department Store.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Email correspondence Chris Vokes & Regina Cappitelli

Interpreter Kossel is sworn in.  Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 9:30 am.
